intro: Albuca tenuis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved albuca, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It is a perennial herb that produces bulbs, which are adapted for storing water and nutrients. Albuca tenuis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique flowering habit.
